litter_guess: m_c hopes the litter will be small - {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/feel/feels} overwhelmed at the idea of a big litter.

m_c wonders how much of {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} expanding belly is kits and how much is pregnancy weight.
m_c has no idea how big {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} should craft the nest in the nursery {PRONOUN/m_c/subject}{VERB/m_c/'re/'s} creating - but it needs the softest materials, the best moss.
m_c feels heavy and bloated, {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} joints hurting with the extra weight of the litter held snugly between. Very snugly. Uncomfortably snugly.

{PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP}{VERB/m_c/'re/'s} endearing proud to be carrying the next generation, it's all m_c can talk about.

m_c feels like {PRONOUN/m_c/subject}{VERB/m_c/'re/'s} eating enough at each meal to feed an army, {PRONOUN/m_c/subject}{VERB/m_c/'re/'s} predicting a big litter. Or perhaps one very plump kit.
m_c has begun hoarding little trinkets, stashing bits of fluff and feather and shiny rocks into {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} birthing nest to stock it with kitten toys.
m_c invites {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} friends to feel {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} litter kick - surely these kittens are going to be talented warriors, because, well - ow.

{PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/m_c/don't/doesn't} believe {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} can efficiently perform {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} duties while expecting kits and {VERB/m_c/decide/decides} to move into the nursery.

It's time to settle into the nursery, and make sure everything is perfectly prepared.
{PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP}{VERB/m_c/'re/'s} scolded into taking up a nest in the nursery, despite {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} best protests.
{PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP}{VERB/m_c/'re/'s} keen to move into the nursery quickly, as though by doing so {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} litter will get the message and appear sooner.

{PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/m_c/choose/chooses} to continue {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} duties as usual for now.

c_n wants to congratulate m_c - but the rising celebration is interrupted by m_c snapping, completely unprovoked, that this pregnancy doesn't make {PRONOUN/m_c/object} a wilting flower and {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} will not be moving {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} nest. Pregnancy hormones are terrifying.

comment: both the minor and major severity strings will appear in conjunction with either a litter guess or an announcement. Write them accordingly!
They should also start with a space in order to ensure there is a space between the announcement/litter sentence and the severity sentence.
